alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL ST. LOUIS COUNTY THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mountain Iron, to 8 miles southeast of Cherry, to Meadowlands, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia, Eveleth and Mountain Iron around 305 PM CDT. Gilbert around 310 PM CDT. Biwabik and Cotton around 320 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Aurora, Embarrass and Tower. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis
